properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heat event continues today. Daytime highs in the upper twenties are expected once again today. Humidex values are forecast to be in the mid thirties. A low pressure system is expected to move through the area tonight into Wednesday bringing cooler temperatures behind it. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-10T07:36:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-09T15:37:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0309989855.2019
Area: Upsala - Raith, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: High Wind Effect Warning Issued For The South Basin Of Lake Manitoba, And For The Shorelines Near Gimli On The West And Victoria Beach On The East Side Of Lake Winnipeg.
properties.Summary:
Description: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure’s Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a high wind effect warning for south basin of Lake Manitoba, and for the shorelines near Gimli on the west and Victoria Beach on the east side of Lake Winnipeg. High winds are forecast to develop around midnight and are expected to last until 12:00pm on July 10, 2019. Wind speed and wave action could raise water levels as much as five feet or more. Be watchful as these winds can result in significant and forceful wave action on shorelines. Property owners in the affected area should take all necessary precautions to stay safe.
Expires: 2019-07-10T12:00:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-07-09T14:08:11-05:00, 3482376B-CBC6-F27B-42E3-37496B5170F1
Area: South basin of Lake Manitoba, and shorelines near Gimli on the west and Victoria Beach on the east side of Lake Winnipeg.
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: As of 8 pm rain continues in southeastern Saskatchewan, with Estevan having reported nearly 75 mm of precipitation with this event so far today. The rain will taper off this evening as the system moves eastward into Manitoba. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke plumes are moving over Western and Southern Quebec because of several fires over Northwestern Ontario. Air quality conditions could deteriorate if the smoke spread at ground level. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-10T15:49:24-00:00

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A heat event is expected Wednesday and Thursday. Daytime high temperatures will be near thirty degrees with humidex values in the high thirties. Overnight low temperatures are expected to be near twenty degrees, which will not provide much relief from the heat. Hot and humid conditions are expected through the weekend so the heat event may continue for a few days. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-10T13:02:48-00:00

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert: Overland Flow Flood Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: Update 2 – The flooding in Yellowhead County can impact local residents by possibly contaminating water wells and sewer systems, and residents should contact the county to report these issues. The areas of Niton Junction, Carrot Creek, and low-lying areas along the Lobstick River to the east, and the Chip Lake area as water flows towards the Pembina River currently have flooding in their area.### Following the impact of floodwater on local residences, water well contamination and sewage issues are possible. Residents are encouraged to contact the Emergency Operations Centre hotline at 1-833-334-4630 to report any such issues and to have their water supplies tested for contamination. Dangerous driving conditions are reported on: - Township Rd. 532 west of Range Rd. 125 - Old Carrot Creek Highway between Range Rd. 140 and Range Rd. 141 - Range Rd. 135 North of Township Rd. 540 - no vehicle exit for residents - Niton North Road south of Township Rd. 542 - Niton North Road south of the railway crossing - Township Rd. 542 west of Niton North Road - no vehicle exit for residents - Range Rd. 135 south of Township Rd. 534 More available at https://www.facebook.com/yellowheadcounty/ Facebook page.
Expires: 2019-07-16T17:06:09-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Yellowhead County, 2019-07-09T17:04:34-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5912
Area: Yellowhead County
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Yellowhead County

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution due to smoke from forest fires will continue tonight for a large part of Northern Ontario. Smoke plumes are moving over the region from several forest fires located in the Sandy Lake - Pikangikum region. There are also additional smaller fires in Northeastern Ontario. Air quality may deteriorate if the smoke descends to ground level. If you or someone in your care develops symptoms, reduce or reschedule strenuous outdoor activities until the air quality improves. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-10T20:35:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-07-10T04:36:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2465370146.2019
Area: Attawapiskat, Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake, Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell, Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake, Pickle Lake - Cat Lake, Webequie, Fort Hope - Lansdowne House - Ogoki, Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park, Ear Falls - Perrault Falls - Western Lac Seul, Armstrong - Auden - Wabakimi Park, Beardmore - Jellicoe - Macdiarmid, Nakina - Aroland - Pagwa, Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat, Manitouwadge - Hornepayne, Fort Albany, Moosonee, Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Kapuskasing - Hearst - Smooth Rock Falls, Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake, Timmins - Cochrane - Iroquois Falls
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentrations of fine particulates are expected and will result in poor air quality. Smoke plumes are moving into Southwestern Quebec from several wildfires in Northwestern Ontario. Air quality may deteriorate at ground level. High levels of pollutants are expected to persist until Wednesday morning. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-10T17:59:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal, 2019-07-09T22:32:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0808712438.2019

properties.Summary:
Description: Hot and humid conditions are expected through Wednesday. Daytime high temperatures will be near thirty degrees with humidex values in the mid thirties. Overnight low temperatures tonight are expected to be in the mid to high teens, which will not provide much relief from the heat. A low pressure system is expected to move through the area on Thursday bringing cooler temperatures with it. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy rainfall of 50 to 75 mm tonight into Wednesday. The heaviest rain will fall overnight into Wednesday morning. Rain will be accompanied by a thunderstorm or two in some areas, resulting in a few locally higher rainfall totals of 75 to 100 mm. Lighter rain will continue through the day Wednesday. This rainfall event is as a result of an area of low pressure expected to move northeast across the region on Wednesday. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-10T20:04:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T04:05:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1646678899.2019
Area: Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park, Ear Falls - Perrault Falls - Western Lac Seul, Sioux Lookout - Eastern Lac Seul, Kenora - Grassy Narrows - Whitedog
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Rain across much of southern Manitoba will continue tonight, with total accumulations near 50 mm expected from southwestern Manitoba across the northern Red River Valley including Winnipeg then into the Whiteshell. As of 7 pm numerous stations in the southwest have reported rainfall totals in excess of 30 mm, with one or two stations already at 50+ mm. Further rain is expected tonight with the heaviest bands moving from the southwest of the province to the Whiteshell area by morning. Rain will taper off in the southwest overnight, in the Red River valley in the morning, and in the Whiteshell early in the afternoon. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-10T14:39:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T00:20:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1624215551.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 11:36 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to ping pong ball size hail and torrential rain. A cluster of severe thunderstorms along the northern edge of Calgary are moving southeast at 15 km/h. This storm is expected to mainly affect northern sections of the city of Calgary and communities to the north of the city. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-10T07:40:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T05:37:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1993901238.2019
Area: Rocky View Co. near Airdrie and Crossfield, City of Calgary
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 9:42 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to ping pong ball size hail and torrential rain. A cluster of severe thunderstorms are located 15 km north of Cochrane and are moving southeast at 15 km/h. ### Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-10T06:40:31-00:00

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentrations of fine particulates are expected and will result in poor air quality. Smoke plumes are moving into Southwestern Quebec from several wildfires in Northwestern Ontario. Air quality may deteriorate at ground level. High levels of pollutants are expected to persist until Wednesday morning. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-10T17:59:55-00:00

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. AIR QUALITY ADVISORY FOR YUKON The office of the Yukon Chief Medical Officer of Health has issued an Air Quality Advisory for all Yukon communities due to high or increasing concentrations of wildfire smoke. Wildfires in Alaska and central Yukon are causing increased concentrations of smoke throughout the territory. Local conditions may also affect the concentration of smoke in each community. Please note that there is no immediate wildfire threat to any Yukon communities. Smoke can impact your health if it lingers in your community. Please observe the following recommendations: - You may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, eye or throat irritation, or shortness of breath. If you are experiencing symptoms, limit outdoor activity and/or strenuous physical activity; if breathing becomes difficult or uncomfortable, stop or reduce the activity. - Make sure you identify and support those who are at increased risk from wildfire smoke. These include small children, elders, pregnant women, and those with lung or heart disease. - If you have a health condition that could worsen with the smoke (asthma, chronic lung disease or COPD, or heart disease) check in with your health care provider to make sure that you have a plan for managing your condition. Make sure your medications and supplies are available and up-to-date. - Reduce exposure to smoky air by staying indoors and turning on an air cleaner with a HEPA filter, if you have one. Keep indoor air as clean as possible by avoiding smoking or burning other materials. - If your symptoms worsen or you are concerned about your health or the health of a friend/family member, contact the health line at 811, contact your health care provider, or go to your Community Health Centre or hospital emergency department. - For advice about keeping your home air clean and cool visit www.hss.gov.yk.ca/wildfiresmoke.php - To view an hourly forecast of smoke conditions in Yukon, visit www.firesmoke.ca/forecasts/current ### Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-10T16:18:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Government of Yukon, 2019-07-10T00:19:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3881837421.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locally heavy rainfall possible tonight into Wednesday. Rain and isolated thunderstorms are expected tonight as a low pressure system approaches the area. Rainfall amounts are forecast to be highly variable across the region, with a few areas receiving 20 to 40 mm, and local 50 mm possible in areas that receive a thunderstorm. The precipitation will taper off late Wednesday as the low pressure system moves away to the northeast. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-10T12:50:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T04:51:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2437835148.2019
Area: Savant Lake - Sturgeon Lake, Sioux Narrows - Nestor Falls - Morson, Dryden - Vermilion Bay, Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy rainfall of 50 to 75 mm tonight into Wednesday. The heaviest rain will fall overnight into Wednesday morning. Rain will be accompanied by a thunderstorm or two in some areas, resulting in a few locally higher rainfall totals of 75 to 100 mm. Lighter rain will continue through the day Wednesday. This rainfall event is as a result of an area of low pressure expected to move northeast across the region on Wednesday. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-10T20:04:14-00:00
